speaker: Dark Forest
lines: Paths plait and unplait like braids loosened by the wind.
Leaves speak in a language that prefers you don't understand.
Birdsong edits itself when you arrive; the chorus forgets your name on purpose.
Sap runs slower here, thinking long thoughts about knives and spring.
A waystone leans under moss; someone carved an eye in it and the moss learned to blink.
Mushrooms litter the trail like coinsâ€”white for safe, red for sorry, black for soon.
The light is not lost. It is hiding to see what you do.
The forest listens with more ears than you brought.

choices.text: Follow the hunter's trail cut with careful boots.
Step onto the moss path where no one steps twice the same way.
Enter the whispering clearing where ferns lean like eavesdroppers.
